intro: Achyrocline insularis, commonly known as the island achyrocline, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are often clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
